Key Arguments: The proposed ACMA powers are unnecessary because past instances of alleged misinformation have been proven true.
Censorship of free speech is dangerous and reminiscent of authoritarian regimes.
Free expression allows truth to emerge naturally, especially in scientific discourse.
The Covid-19 vaccine mandates were based on misinformation, and opposing views should have been allowed.
Determining what constitutes misinformation is subjective and should not be controlled by the government.
Notable Quotes: The people who try and censor free speech are never the good guys.
We need to allow all sides to have input into any important discussions in society and then let individuals decide for themselves what is ‘their’ truth.
This just proves why we cannot have censorship on free speech.

The Australian Government is trying to ‘sell’ these proposed changes as being overseen by an independent body but frankly I do not believe that for one moment and it seems to be a power grab by the government.
